casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Thomas Craig CAMPBELL No. 252PA14-3 Supreme Court of North Carolina. June 7, 2018 Ms. Barbara S. Blackman, Durham, Assistant Appellate Defender, for Campbell, Thomas Craig Ms. Teresa M. Postell, Assistant Attorney General, for State of North Carolina Ms. Hannah H. Love, Assistant Appellate Defender, for Campbell, Thomas Craig Mr. Mike Miller, District Attorney, for State

ORDER

Upon consideration of the petition filed by State of NC on the 15th of February 2018 for Writ of Supersedeas of the judgment of the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 7th of June 2018."

Upon consideration of the petition for discretionary review, filed by State of NC on the 12th of March 2018 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-31 and the Appellate Rule 16(b) as to issues in addition to those presented as the basis for the dissenting opinion in the Court of Appeals, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the petition for discretionary review as to additional issues is

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 7th of June 2018."

Accordingly, the new brief of the State of NC shall be filed with this Court not more than 30 days from the date of certification of this order.
